text: English mini lesson number nine the
topic Black Friday
here in the United States Thanksgiving
is just around the corner as you
probably know Thanksgiving is a very
special holiday to Americans but there's
also something important that happens
after Thanksgiving do you know what it
is well you'll soon find out in this
lesson when is Black Friday listen and
learn the answer
Thanksgiving in America happens to be on
a fourth Thursday of November like
Friday is the day after Thanksgiving is
what we think of it as I think usually
did you listen closely
when is Black Friday is it the first
Friday of November the fourth Friday in
November or the Friday before
Thanksgiving
it's the fourth Friday in November the
day after Thanksgiving
what is Black Friday listen and learn
the answer it's a day when retailers
give great discounts so that they can
spur the economy a little bit before
Christmas ends and their selling season
is at a finish Black Friday signals the
beginning of the Christmas shopping
season in America it's a day when
retailers bring the costs of their goods
down a great deal in order to get people
to shop before Christmas they want to
make sure that the economy stays good
for the holiday season and I think of
Black Friday as being a possible crash
day and this is their way of preventing
it
most people in America take take a day
after Thanksgiving off and they go
shopping according to what you just
heard what is not true about Black
Friday it's a day to buy gifts it's a
day stores make a profit or it's a day
to receive gifts
it's not a day to receive gifts people
go shopping and they begin to buy gifts
why is it called Black Friday listen and
learn the answer I think they started
that because of a gold market crashed a
long time ago so it was a reflective of
a bad economic day and I think we've
tailors took it over for the day after
Thanksgiving so that they could make
sure their shopping season state
economically healthy and this is the day
when most retailers chart a profit on an
annual basis and so if you look at the
financial statements they go from ran
into black hence the name Black Friday
recall one explanation you heard for the
name Black Friday which of these three
statements is true based on what you
heard business owners go into debt on
this Friday it's a dark day for them
shoppers go crazy on this Friday and
cause much trouble retail stores show no
losses on this Friday only profit
answer the last one
the term Black Friday has helped
different meanings throughout American
history apparently more than a century
ago there was a stock market crash that
occurred on a Friday and I also read
somewhere that a few decades ago there
were reports of terrible traffic
problems that occurred on the Friday
after Thanksgiving because of all of the
holiday travelers so such terrible
troublesome dark events that happened on
a Friday were appropriately thought of
as Black Friday but today I think most
Americans share a common understanding
of Black Friday as being the Friday
after Thanksgiving which is known as the
busiest shopping day of the year now
black in Black Friday I believe refers
to an old accounting practice when books
were kept by hand and red was used to
show a loss of profit and black was used
to show that there was profit so today
we have the idioms in the red and in the
black
Black Friday then is the day when most
Americans begin their holiday shopping
holiday doesn't just refer to Christmas
because in the United States there are
other holidays celebrated at the end of
the year 1000 Hanukkah are examples so
customers are attracted by extreme
discounts at extremely early hours
stores open their doors
around dawn we're talking 5 a.m.
sometimes even earlier some stores open
their doors at 12 o'clock midnight
people line up in front of the stores
they camp out all night long sometimes
they have chairs blankets sleeping bags
because they want to be a
the first people through the doors to
get the best deals now of course all of
these great discounts can be good but it
also creates a lot of craziness there
can be chaos and chaos can be dangerous
in some cases in the recent past there
have been physical injuries because of
the mad rushed into the stores to get
electronics or toys at very low prices
because of that craziness some people
avoid the crowds and they wait to do
their holiday shopping later I think
that's one reason why we also have the
term cyber monday this is the Monday
immediately after Thanksgiving some
people now choose to do their holiday
shopping online
they don't do shopping during the
holiday weekend meaning after
Thanksgiving they wait until that Monday
at work or at home to get on their
computer and they begin shopping online
for their holiday presents do you
yourself shop on Black Friday I have
once but I don't usually it's a little
bit too crazy a little bit too many
people rushing for the same items when
do you do your holiday shopping I tend
to start a little before Thanksgiving
and I just do it each weekend until
Christmas gets here let's review some
vocabulary from this lesson

help improve the economy stimulate it be

be shoppers or see bargain hunters
answer a4 on an annual basis means a
happening only this year be happening
every year or see happening throughout

answer b5 in the red means a showing
profit be showing a loss of money or see
guilty of stealing money
answer be six in the black means a
showing profit be showing a loss of
money or see guilty of stealing money
answer a7 give incentives to shoppers
means a give more time to shop create
longer store hours B give help to
shoppers or C give reasons to shop
encourage sales

find the best stores B find the best
